definition: to regard as/to figure/to calculate/to compute

plate/dish/tray/board/hard drive (computing)/to build/to coil/to check/to examine/to transfer (property)/to make over/classifier for food: dish, helping/to coil/classifier for coils of wire/classifier for games of chess
counting one's chickens before they are hatched
to compute on the abacus/(fig.) to calculate/to plan/to scheme
lit. to count on a narrow abacus (idiom); petty and scheming selfishly/concerned with petty interests/selfish and uncaring of the interests of others/bean counter

sentences.english: Because the abacus is a daily-use device made from wood, few of them have survived.
sentences.chinese: 因为算盘是一种木质的日常用具，流传下来的很少。

sentences.english: Your thinking is too small, also miscalculated the.
sentences.chinese: 你的算盘太小，也打错了。

sentences.english: Why is the abacus such an effective teaching device?
sentences.chinese: 为什么算盘有效地帮助了教学？

sentences.english: In agreeing so readily, he had an axe to grind.
sentences.chinese: 他满口答应了这件事，是有他自己的算盘的。

sentences.english: As the students learn to manipulate the beads on the abacus, they learn to add and subtract.
sentences.chinese: 学生在算盘上拨拉算珠，学习加减。

sentences.english: Abacuses are so fast and accurate that people still use them today.
sentences.chinese: 算盘如此快和准确以致于现在人们仍在使用它。

sentences.english: The room was very quiet. Even the sound of the abacus was stilled.
sentences.chinese: 屋子里宁静了片刻，算盘珠子的声音也已经停止了。

sentences.english: An abacus is also a counting machine, using our brain and our fingers.
sentences.chinese: 算盘也是一台计数器，用人们的头脑和手指来操做。

sentences.english: I could write on paper and use abacus for statistic.
sentences.chinese: 我可以用纸笔写作，要算统计时就打算盘。

sentences.english: But I am interested in using an abacus.
sentences.chinese: 可我对打算盘还是很感兴趣。

sentences.english: The girl went back without anything. She felt very sad. "Ah, my child , "said her mother.
sentences.chinese: 母亲说”我的孩子，不要过早地去打如意算盘。

sentences.english: So am I. Using an abacus is still a basic accounting.
sentences.chinese: 我也一样，打算盘仍然是会计的基本技能。

sentences.english: Abacus symbolizes good fortune and wise decision-making.
sentences.chinese: 算盘象征好运和精打细算。

sentences.english: However, all may have ambitions of their own.
sentences.chinese: 然而，每个人都可能打着自己的如意小算盘。

definition: counting one's chickens before they are hatched
to reckon/to calculate/to plan/to expect/to scheme
lit. to count on a narrow abacus (idiom); petty and scheming selfishly/concerned with petty interests/selfish and uncaring of the interests of others/bean counter
to lend sb a knife to kill sb/to get sb else to do one's dirty work/to attack using the strength of another (idiom)
delaying tactics/stalling/measures to stave off an attack/stratagem to win a respite
sit on the mountain and watch the tigers fight/watch in safety whilst others fight then reap the rewards when both sides are exhausted (idiom)
